channel.title: Make client "port" editable by user
channel.description:
When you load the client and try to log in it says
Username: Password: Server ip: Port:
You can change them all except for the port, and I want to know how to make the "port" field editable by anyone who uses the client.
Here is a code snippet I found.
[code] aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Port: " + port + ((anInt1216 == 3) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15; [/code]
[img]http://i536.photobucket.com/albums/ff321/zipl0ck/port.jpg[/img]

item.title: Make client "port" editable by user
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

If your talking about a Jframe then no. It dose not have a Jframe.

Read full topic

item.title: Make client "port" editable by user
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

When you load the client and try to log in it says

Username:
Password:
Server ip:
Port:

You can change them all except for the port, and I want to know how to make the “port” field editable by anyone who uses the client.

Here is a code snippet I found.

            aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Port: " + port + ((anInt1216 == 3) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j);
            j += 15;
